author: Richard Barley
title: Turkey Is the One to Watch for Emerging Markets Risk
text:
In a world where the dollar has been weakening, Turkey’s lira, remarkably, is managing to be weaker still. For investors concerned more broadly about problems being masked by a world awash in easy money, Turkey is the one to watch.
The lira has in recent days hit record lows against both the dollar and euro; it is down 4.8% against the greenback this year, adding to 2017’s decline. By contrast, many other emerging-market currencies have risen, allowing central banks to diverge from U.S. rate rises and supporting appetite...
